body_html:
Bazel packaging for Debian seems stuck for a long time because bazel doesn't meet Debian's policy. One of the developers working on it has told me that it's hard to get it done.

https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=782654

I think the only linux distribution that ships bazel, tensorflow (and cudnn) in its official archive is Archlinux. https://www.archlinux.org/packages/?sort=&q=tensorflow&maintainer=&flagged=

body:
Bazel packaging for Debian seems stuck for a long time because bazel doesn't meet Debian's policy. One of the developers working on it has told me that it's hard to get it done.

https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=782654

I think the only linux distribution that ships bazel, tensorflow (and cudnn) in its official archive is Archlinux. https://www.archlinux.org/packages/?sort=&q=tensorflow&maintainer=&flagged=
